ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: This paper is a revised version of a technical paper provided in support of a Health Report Card produced for the UK Living With Environmental Change (LWEC) Network. Jouni Paavola acknowledges the financial support from the Living with Environmental Change (LWEC) programme for the writing of an earlier version of this article. The article also contributes to the research programme of the Centre for Climate Change Economics and Policy (CCCEP), a joint research centre of University of Leeds and London School of Economics and Political Science. The financial support of the UK Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC) to CCCEP is gratefully acknowledged. I thank Sari Kovats and the three anomomous reviewers for their comments on earlier versions of this article.

sec.title: Funding
sec.p: Publication of this article was funded by the UK Living With Environmental Change (LWEC) Network. LWEC was succeeded in 2016 by the Research and Innovation for our Dynamic Environment (RIDE) Forum ( http://www.nerc.ac.uk/research/partnerships/ride/). Part of the author’s time was also funded by the ESRC Centre of Climate Change Economics and Policy (CCCEP).

sec.title: Availability of data and materials
sec.p: The only data that was used for this article is composed of the articles cited. They are available publicly, but not all may be available without charge or subscription.

sec.title: About this supplement
sec.p: This article has been published as part of Environmental Health Volume 16 Supplement 1, 2017: Special Issue on the impact of climate change on health in the UK. The full contents of the supplement are available online at https://ehjournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/supplements/volume-16-supplement-1.
